# Cloning a GitHub repository into your local computer using RStudio {#sec-clone-repository}

This tutorial is a summary of the the instructions described [here](https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/creating-and-managing-repositories/cloning-a-repository).

## Get the GitHub repository URL

![](images/clone_step1.png)

### 1. Go to the repository's GitHub page {.unnumbered}

Click on the green button that is labeled code.

### 2. Copy the repository URL {.unnumbered}

Click on the copy to clipboard icon to copy the repository URL.

## Go to RStudio and create new project
![](images/clone_step2.png)

## Choose Version Control
![](images/clone_step3.png)

## Select Git

![](images/clone_step4.png)

## Setup repository settings

![](images/clone_step5.png)

### 1. Paste the repository URL you copied earlier {.unnumbered}

### 2. Set the project directory name {.unnumbered}

The project directory name should be specified already after you paste the repository URL. Use the suggested directory name.
    
### 3. Set local directory {.unnumbered}

Browse for the directory on your local computer where you want to save the files for the specified project.

### 4. Create project {.unnumbered}

Click on the `Create Project` button/icon.

You will now have the GitHub repository in your local computer.
